user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of SHA1PadMessage:
```c
static void
SHA1PadMessage (struct SHA1Context *context)
{
  if (context->message_block_index > 55)
  {
    context->message_block[context->message_block_index++] = 0x80;
    while (context->message_block_index < 64)
    {
      context->message_block[context->message_block_index++] = 0;
    }
    SHA1ProcessMessageBlock (context);
    while (context->message_block_index < 56)
    {
      context->message_block[context->message_block_index++] = 0;
    }
  }
  else
  {
    context->message_block[context->message_block_index++] = 0x80;
    while (context->message_block_index < 56)
    {
      context->message_block[context->message_block_index++] = 0;
    }
  }
  context->message_block[56] = (unsigned char) (context->length_high >> 24);
  context->message_block[57] = (unsigned char) (context->length_high >> 16);
  context->message_block[58] = (unsigned char) (context->length_high >> 8);
  context->message_block[59] = (unsigned char) (context->length_high);
  context->message_block[60] = (unsigned char) (context->length_low >> 24);
  context->message_block[61] = (unsigned char) (context->length_low >> 16);
  context->message_block[62] = (unsigned char) (context->length_low >> 8);
  context->message_block[63] = (unsigned char) (context->length_low);
  SHA1ProcessMessageBlock (context);
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
while (context->message_block_index < 56)
    {
      context->message_block[context->message_block_index++] = 0;
    }
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation. The while (context->message_block_index < 56) loop can execute in the else branch (when message_block_index <= 55 after inserting 0x80) and is also expected to execute in the if branch after SHA1ProcessMessageBlock resets message_block_index (typical SHA‑1 implementations reset the index to 0). Even if SHA1ProcessMessageBlock did not reset the index, the loop would still be reachable via the else path, so the fragment is not unreachable code and Rule 2.1 is not violated.
